fields.description: If you review a file which has been copied to a branch/tag, light svn will attempt to find the previous revision at the new path, and will complain when it doesn't exist, while trying to display the diff.
fields.summary: SVN LightSCM plugin tries to get revision which don't exist when copies are made

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Import the Svn dump attached. 
2) Configure the  liteSVN plugin to point to the repository where you have imported the dump
3) Create a new review and add changeset 15 
4) In the logs you will see 

{noformat}
WARN  - Couldn't update details on Crucible Revision
java.lang.RuntimeException: No revision found for trunk/NCM - Network Configuration Management 15
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.scm.SCMSource.getFileRevisionInfo(SCMSource.java:221)
        at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.managers.DefaultContentManager$Updater.run(DefaultContentManager.java:209)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:417)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:269)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:123)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:650)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:675)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
{noformat}

and the file in the review will show an updating next to it (like in the screen shot).
fields.summary: File in Review shows up as "Updating" and does not show source due to a Runtime Exception thrown by the SVNlite plugin

fields.description:
com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserLogin has two methods (getUserName() and getUsername()) that behave identically (one calls the other). Both methods are heavily relied on by various part of the codebase.
Deprecating one is non-trivial as getUserName() is declared by the implmented interface com.cenqua.crucible.model.Principal.

Just a minor issue.
fields.summary: UserLogin has ambiguous methods

fields.description: It would be really nice if we could configure auto-creation of crucible reviews. This should probably be configurable on a per-repository (or per-path/project) basis.
fields.summary: Optional per-project auto-creation of crucible reviews
rework from CR-FE-679: always do an automatic db backup before upgrade

fields.description:
This issue represents Phase I of backup/restore functionality in FE/CRU.

This will provide a canonical snapshot of all relevant user data from FE and CRU, captured into a zip file.

Usecases:

1. support backup/restore
2. support database migration
3. support instance migration


needs specification in consultation with other teams who have solved this problem.
fields.summary: Commandline Backup/Restore

fields.description:
It seems that https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/rest-service/users-v1 (and in all other Crucible 1.6+ instances) is not protected at all (i.e. you don't need to be logged in to retrieve all details).
Is it intentional? I am asking as personal information is somewhat sensitive in most of the companies.

Cheers,

Wojtek
fields.summary: No authentication required to retrieve user list in API

fields.description:
because then Crucible will only think the file has one version, and hence that same version will appear in every review.

Instead, we should use last-mod-time, and a contents-fetch of a revision that no longer exists fails.

fields.description: Current behavior, if you add a bunch of comments on a review on code not part of the diff - they all get lumped together with no code visible unless you 'show full source', at which point, you have to scan through for the comments spread out. Would be nice to be able to just display the context on a comment-by-comment basis.
fields.summary: Add js link next to comments to 'show context' when a comment is on code that is not visible unless 'show full source' is chosen

Upgrade to Jersey 1.0, and include jersey-spring for possible future springification

fields.description:
Hitting "Post" or "Save as Draft" before the *first* autosave ajax request returns results in a spurious second comment because both posts are sent without a comment id.

Possible strategies:

# trigger an autosave on the first keypress and disable the buttons until it returns with a commentid.
# detect when the first autosave has been triggered but not returned and wait for the commentid before posting
fields.summary: Autosave race condition

fields.description: When I'm using Crucible for a review and I expand all, that kicks off a number of Ajax requests. If they timeout, the whole Crucible page is replaced with the "Sorry, Mate" holder page which is a bit disconcerting and potentially will lose data (review comments). There's a few timeouts occurring at the mo.
fields.summary: When in Crucible, a AJAX timeout destroys the Crucible page
Add this change to the release notes
DELETE operations in Crucible REST should return status 204 "No Content" to be more RESTful
Improve file upload diff to allow full control over comparison whether to ignore blanks, case, regular-expressions, new lines etc.

fields.description:
Currently if you have a crucible eval license you get access to fisheye. 

However once you purchase a commercial crucible licences and replace the eval license with it, you lose access to all fisheye capabilities. 

This is confusing to customers. We need to add some sort of warning that make it clear to customers that they need to enter a fisheye commercial license as well. 

Is there some less confusing way we can go about this. E.g. have seperate crucible and crucible+fisheye downloads so people can evaluate crucible alone and when they buy the license they get the exact same thing. 
Otherwise it is strange (as we have an eval license that unlocks more of the product that a commercial one!!!).
fields.summary: Add warning that if user does not enter fisheye license they will not have access to fisheye capabilites

fields.description:
Crucbile and FishEye do not display timestamps in the timezone of the user, but instead always use the server's local time. On EAC for example, US timestamps are displayed (without timezone information), which look a bit strange if you're in a different timezone. Confluence does adjust timestamps to the local user's timeone when displaying.

Crucible does not store a user's timezone, so it's difficult make adjustments on the server, but possibly they can be converted on the client side in javascript.

Not a biggie.
fields.summary: Crucible displays server timezone, not local timezone
Improve Confluence Light SCM Performance
make scroll to changeset look better

fields.description:
Matt Quail  [ #permalink | (16 October 2008, 22:28)  ]   	 ^  v   	    	 Reply
how do defaults work here when it is a primitive? Does it default to false/0/0.0? Eg, if "complete" is not a query parameter, this defaults to false? That is different to null. That is, "compete==false" is different to "don't check complete at all".
Ah, I see that CustomFilterData uses boolean not Boolean. Does that mean that a filter cannot not-filter on "complete"? Should we change that?

Erik van Zijst [ 16 October 2008, 23:10 ] 		Edit 	Delete
Yes, I thought about that too. They default to false, which leads to an interesting situation: when you create a new review without specifying reviewers, you will not find the review if you do a filter on "states=drafts" only. Instead, you MUST add "allReviewersComplete=true", because when omitted, it defaults to false and because there are no reviewers, everyone is complete!

Marek/Tom, should we change these to Boolean both here and in CustomFilterData?

Marek Went [ 17 October 2008, 02:00 ] 	
Yes, good idea. OF course then we have to handle it inside ReviewService.

Tom Davies [ 19 October 2008, 19:05 ] 	
Yes -- boolean is definitely a bug.
fields.summary: Custom filter object in Crucible REST should not use primitive values

fields.description:
DiffHelper.getDiffExp() currently returns null when one of the specified revisions is non-text. However:

 Tom Davies  [ #permalink | (19 October 2008, 19:01)  ]   	 ^  v   	    	 Reply
Can we not return a DiffExplorer which shows the contents of the new file?
Or at least does something sensible -- even changing the DiffExplorer interface to provide a reason why the diff can't be seen? I'd be more comfortable with something like that than null.

Also see: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-666#c5323
fields.summary: Let DiffExplorer support non-text files

fields.description:
From support case [CRC-373|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-373]. 

Currently if you make several draft comments and wish to review/post them all at once, the only way you can do that is by completing the review. After that if you create more draft comments that you wish to submit at once, you need to uncomplete then complete the review again. 

It would be good, if we add some button to review all draft comments without having to complete the review. 

Also it would be good if all of these draft comments which you wish to post at once, are sent in the one email (rather than an email per a comment).
fields.summary: Be able to review all draft comments and either post/discard/edit them without having to close the review.

fields.summary: Deadlock in HSQL?
[crucible] in the closed review email subject

fields.description: If an reviewer has not worked on a Review for long time period, it would be nice to remind him that there is a review which needs an update.
fields.summary: Operation "Remind Reviewer"

fields.description:
The migration of the liteSCM plugins in Crucible 1.6.2 from the FishEye/Crucible  code repository to the public contrib repository and the consequent package name change will invalidate the plugin config for any users who have configured a light SCM repo in Crucible 1.6.1

This needs to at least be documented in the 1.6.2 release notes.
fields.summary: Plugin config change will affect user configs
Get Selenium Tests working

fields.description:
The diff context bar should show for patch reviews.

This may not be trivial. Make sure it is consistent against all types of reviews, patch, upload, lightscm, fisheye.
fields.summary: Add inline diff option bar to patch reviews

fields.description:
Auto save saves comments as draft comments while typing. If the user changes their mind and cancels the comment there is a draft still attached to the review but not visible until the Reviewer either reloads or completes the review and they have to delete it.

I suggest cancel should delete the draft.
fields.summary: Auto save draft comment needs to delete the draft on cancel

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce (need to use system where there a lot of changesets (so try eac/crucible in atlassian). 

1) Crucible > Create Review
2) Enter in title and reviewers etc, 
3) In the changesets tab click earlier 

Title disappears
fields.summary: Title is wiped out

fields.description:
If you enter an expired fe licence, but a valid cru licence on the setup page, Crucible behaves as though you had simply not specified a Fisheye licence, instead of warning that your licence wasn't valid.

This is confusing.
fields.summary: Setup page doesn't warn of invalid fe licence when valid cru licence is provided
summary email includes deleted comments

fields.description:
From HSQL forums

"Conclusion The bottomline is that you should use HSQLDB only in Memory Table mode, instead of CACHED tables mode. If you need CACHED table mode due to memory limitations then you should consider a different database."
fields.summary: Switch from CACHED tables mode back to memory table.

fields.description:
Images don't render inline or raw?

e.g. https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-654

!http://img.skitch.com/20081014-ch1b763m1tm12cfdaeq1a86ec.png!
fields.summary: Images in patches don't work

fields.description: It would be useful for an authorised user to be able to change the moderator of a review to a different user.
fields.summary: Change moderator via REST

fields.description:
As discussed in IM,

pmc: looks like a directory not being recognised /trunk/src/java/org/apache/lucene
fields.summary: Getting error popup on review due to confusion about a directory.

fields.description:
Please take a look at this email between Soren and me https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/APL-23?focusedCommentId=13555&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_13555


Basically, I don't know what to do to make Applinks link to be rendered as links inside SVN commit comments and Crucible reviews.

Can you help on this ?
fields.summary: Applinks not working for Crucible nor Fisheye

fields.description:
When a user is adding a comment, after a few seconds, automatically save the comment as a Draft.

This will ensure use's don't lose comments if they accidentally close the comment form (eg by closing the window).
fields.summary: Automatically save draft comments (autosave)

fields.description: When trying to remove a single file that has a revision comment using the "Files" tab in the Crucible review, an error string appears that is misaligned.
fields.summary: Error message in Crucible file management is misplaced

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

#  Go into an active review.
# Change the "Diffs" preferences to "Side-by-side" (or change the "Comments" to "Above") via the pulldown lists (see {{side-by-side.JPG}}).
# Refresh the browser.
# Wrongly - the pulldown lists still show my selections, but the review page does not reflect the pulldown lists (see {{after_refresh.JPG}}).

It appears to occur only in the Firefox browser. It does not occur in Internet Explorer.

*Behavior in Internet Explorer*
Refreshes the page refreshes the Diff option back to "Unified". However, the layout is is correctly reflected.
fields.summary: "Side-by-side" Diffs option does not update upon refreshing the Firefox browser

fields.description: Make sure all titles correctly choose the right product.
fields.summary: Crucible without FishEye still says FishEye in titles

fields.description: We have a Perforce change list with well over 100 files affected, and Crucible only shows us the first 100!
fields.summary: Crucible only shows the first 100 files in a changelist

fields.description:
The fisheye-api.jar and/or the fisheye.jar has a compile time dependency on javax.annotation.

If you try to depend on fisheye-api.jar ando/or fisheye.jar in your own project (eg Studio) you get a javac error under jdk1.5 because you don't know about those classes.

Studio had to add this dependency:

        <dependency>
            <groupId>javax.annotation</groupId>
            <artifactId>jsr250-api</artifactId>
            <version>1.0</version>
        </dependency>

It would be good if our deployed pom in question had them too.

fields.description:
from CRUC-543:
 have a checklist associated with the review. Each item on the checklist has a pass/fail, a comment, and possibly an associated Jira issue.

the type of checks would be e.g.
 Code is commented correctly
 Code complies with Architecture Document
 Method Names are clear and correctly cased
 etc etc

Ideally these fields on the checklists would be defined by project, and copyable from other projects.

This requirement comes from Quality (eg ISO 9000) type requirements where the QMS specifies a checklist for code reviews, and we need to measure the results.

------------
 summarize review checklist

At the Review Summary stage, the Developer must ensure:
 # All comments in the review have been responded to adequately
 2. Unit test results have been sighted by a reviewer
 3. Code coverage results have been sighted by a reviewer
 4. If User-facing changes, the running UI has been inspected by a reviewer
 5. JIRAs have been raised for all non-trivial rework required

 
h3. Alternative solution #1:

In 'Administration' > 'Project settings' > project > 'Default review objectives' you can prepare a wiki markup template for review objectives. You can use this template as a checklist. You can use icons like (/) or (x) to mark which tasks have been completed.
h3. Alternative solution #2:

With 'Linking reviews to multiple Jira issues' feature delivered in Crucible 4.6 you can create and link more any number of Jira issues with a single code review. This way you can use Jira to track such if the checklist have been completed.
h3. Alternative solution #3:

It is also possible create Jira issues from comments. They are being displayed on the review summary page. Thus it's possible to create comments and create linked issues for them.
h3. Alternative solution #4:

In Crucible 4.3 the 'Resolvable comments' feature has been delivered. You can create a set of global comments and mark all of them as 'needs resolution'. Review workflow will warn if there are any unresolved comments before closing a review.

fields.description:
Crucible crashed. When we restarted only 4 of our code reviews were still present. We recovered the crucible directory from the previous nights backups and we noticed that the 84MB crucible.log file in the recovered var/data/crudb contains insert statements for the missing code reviews.

We started the recovered crucible but when it had started only the 4 code reviews were present and the crucible.script contains no mention of the missing code reviews. The crucible.log has also been reduced significantly in size.

How can we recover.

I have just discovered support.atlassian.com Jira and this issue is reported there as CRC-358.
fields.summary: Crucible restart lost most of our code reviews.

fields.description:
Hey,

We use a system here whereby one person must be the moderator on all reviews for each team. This means that they have to do a lot of approving and summarizing.

Currently if a moderator is presented with a list of reviews to be approved, he must go 'into' the review, then approve the review and then click back round to get 'Require my approval' list again. For several reviews this can be unnecessarily time consuming. The same applies to Summarizing.

Although sometimes it is certainly necessary to inspect the review before Approving or Summarizing, often it is not, and it would be very helpful to have a 'Quick Approve' or 'Quick Summarize' functionality included.

In the case of Approving the review would simply become Approved and the screen would stay on the 'Require My Approval' list.

In the case of Summarizing a text box would be shown allowing the moderator to enter a summary and close the review whilst staying on the 'To Summarize' screen.

Thanks,

Mark Coleman

Thanks,

Mark

fields.description:
We would like to customise what is shown in the "Comment Results" section of the "Defect Metrics" screen, at present it has:

Review, Name, Created, Custom Fields, Content

Atlassian example

We need a permanent record of the results of a review, and we need more detail than is given here, such as:
a) filename that the comment is for
b) which lines of code the comment refers to.

We also need to know whether a comment has been addressed or not, but I have overcome this by customising the Defect States to "proposed", "implemented" and "rejected".
[ Show » ]
Nick Muldoon [Atlassian] added a comment - 01/Oct/08 11:35 PM From an evaluator: We would like to customise what is shown in the "Comment Results" section of the "Defect Metrics" screen, at present it has: Review, Name, Created, Custom Fields, Content Atlassian example We need a permanent record of the results of a review, and we need more detail than is given here, such as: a) filename that the comment is for b) which lines of code the comment refers to. We also need to know whether a comment has been addressed or not, but I have overcome this by customising the Defect States to "proposed", "implemented" and "rejected".

fields.description:
Some people are ending up with databases with double-ups in the FRX_ORDER column.

This is causing NPEs during close review.

Do other similar columns suffer from this problem?
fields.summary: FR_EXTRA.FRX_ORDER needs a unique constraint

fields.description: Likely related to FE-707 "no comment" is being rendered as the commit message when that is NOT the comment of the revision. Three problems: a) title attributes can not contain html tags (and we don't use ) b) it isn't finding the correct commit message c) the wording in cases where there is no commit message should be "no commit message" (no comment unsurprisingly confuses a lot of people). See screenshot and review https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-608
fields.summary: no comment commit message tooltip

fields.description:
On our privateeye instance, Rich W has the checkbox selected which "Allows anyone to join" on CR-1089. See the screenshot attached.

However, when I go to that review, I can't add myself or anyone else.

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/cru/CR-1089 (private to Atlassian)

I'd rate this as a critical bug because it's significantly hampering use of Crucible for us. We expect product developers to add themselves to common module reviews that they're interested in.
fields.summary: Checkbox which allows anyone to join as reviewer doesn't work
